ai.summary: A short, easy 0.9 km loop along the Craven Lime Works site in the UK, offering a gentle stroll past historic lime kilns and open countryside. Suitable for families and casual walkers seeking a quick, low-effort outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating path with compact gravel and paved sections. Expect some uneven ground near the kilns and potential mud after rain. Overall a low-difficulty surface suitable for most visitors.
ai.safety_notes: Follow marked paths and respect safety signs around the lime works. The route is short but may have uneven ground near kilns; wear sturdy footwear. Check weather before you go and bring layers; mud and rain are common in the UK. Stay hydrated and bring water; keep a small snack if desired. Watch children and pets; keep dogs on a short leash in sensitive areas. In case of emergency, have a mobile phone and know the nearest access points.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing and a lightweight waterproof layer
Map, guidebook, or offline GPS (phone signal may be limited)
Light backpack and a basic first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with the most comfortable conditions in late spring to early autumn; be prepared for rain and mud in winter.
